definitions.definition: to make a short sudden movement, or to cause someone or something to do this:
examples: The car made a strange noise and then jerked to a halt.

definitions.definition: to (force or cause someone or something to) suddenly behave differently, usually by understanding something or becoming active again:
examples: The shock of losing his job jerked him out of his settled lifestyle.
She pulled the bush out of the ground with a sharp jerk.
